sections.heading: Before a Flood
items: Know your local flood risk and evacuation routes.
Prepare an emergency kit with water, food, medications, flashlight, and batteries.
Store important documents in a waterproof container and back them up digitally.
Move valuables to higher levels and elevate electrical appliances if possible.
Purchase flood insurance; standard homeowners insurance usually doesn’t cover floods.

sections.heading: During a Flood
items: Evacuate immediately if told to do so. Follow official routes.
Never walk, swim, or drive through floodwaters. Turn Around, Don’t Drown.
Avoid bridges over fast-moving water; they can be washed out.
Stay off electrical equipment if you are wet or standing in water.
If trapped, move to the highest level. Only go to the roof if necessary and signal for help.

sections.heading: After a Flood
items: Return home only when authorities say it’s safe.
Avoid floodwater; it may be contaminated and hide hazards.
Turn off electricity at the main breaker if safe to do so.
Wear protective gear (boots, gloves, mask) when cleaning up.
Document damage with photos for insurance claims.
